goal.core.mentalstate

Class SingleGoal

  • java.lang.Object
    • goal.core.mentalstate.SingleGoal

  • public class SingleGoal
extends java.lang.Object
    Stores a Database, Update pair that represent a single goal. The database is maintained by the KR technology while the update is used for purposes internal to GOAL.

    If you make duplicate use of a SingleGoal. you should call markOccurrence(). If you don't, SingleGoals may be cleaned up prematurely.

    SingleGoal should not be used outside this package. This is mainly a support class for GoalBase.

    #2884 this was an inner class of GoalBase. However, SingleGoal is being reused by other GoalBases and therefore this was not good. Also the timing info (usage time counting) went wrong that way as the creator (instead of the reuser) was accounted for used time in SingleGoal.

    Author:
    K.Hindriks

    • Constructor Detail

      • SingleGoal

        protected SingleGoal(Update goal,
          AgentId agent,
          KRlanguage language)
        DOC
        Parameters:
        goal - goal to be added. ASSUMES goal consists of a list of database formulas to be added only (i.e. delete and mailbox lists of update are empty).
        agent - The agent this goal is for
        language - The KRlanguage to use
        Throws:
        GOALRuntimeErrorException - see KRlanguage.makeDatabase(goal.core.mentalstate.BASETYPE, java.util.Collection<goal.core.kr.language.DatabaseFormula>, java.lang.String).

        public java.lang.String toString()

        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        string representation of goal.

      • markOccurrence

        protected void markOccurrence()
        Adds one to the counter counting the number of times this SingleGoal is used. Must be undone with unmarkOccurrence().

      • unmarkOccurrence

        protected void unmarkOccurrence()
        Removes one from the counter counting the number of times this SingleGoal is used. If the counter reaches zero, the database is cleaned up.

      • cleanUp

        protected void cleanUp()
        Forces clean up of the KR database. Should be used only as a forced final attempt to clean up, never during normal run. See unmarkOccurrence().

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        SingleGoals are considered equal if the goals, i.e. the Updates they consist of, are equal.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        true if obj is equal to this SingleGoal.
